 17import jmespath
 18from PIL.Image import Image
 19from pydantic import BaseModel, ConfigDict, Field, TypeAdapter
 20from rich.console import Console
 21from rich.panel import Panel

 23from ailoy.ailoy_py import generate_uuid
 24from ailoy.mcp import MCPServer, MCPTool, StdioServerParameters
 25from ailoy.models import APIModel, LocalModel

 30## Types for internal data structures
 31
 32
 33class TextContent(BaseModel):
 34    type: Literal["text"] = "text"
 35    text: str
 36
 37
 38class ImageContent(BaseModel):
 39    class UrlData(BaseModel):
 40        url: str
 41
 42    type: Literal["image_url"] = "image_url"
 43    image_url: UrlData
 44
 45    @staticmethod
 46    def from_url(url: str):
 47        return ImageContent(image_url={"url": url})
 48
 49    @staticmethod
 50    def from_pillow(image: Image):
 51        return ImageContent(image_url={"url": pillow_image_to_base64(image)})
 52
 53
 54class AudioContent(BaseModel):
 55    class AudioData(BaseModel):
 56        data: str
 57        format: Literal["mp3", "wav"]
 58
 59    type: Literal["input_audio"] = "input_audio"
 60    input_audio: AudioData
 61
 62    @staticmethod
 63    def from_bytes(data: bytes, format: Literal["mp3", "wav"]):
 64        return AudioContent(input_audio={"data": base64.b64encode(data).decode("utf-8"), "format": format})
 65
 66
 67class FunctionData(BaseModel):
 68    class FunctionBody(BaseModel):
 69        name: str
 70        arguments: Any
 71
 72    type: Literal["function"] = "function"
 73    id: Optional[str] = None
 74    function: FunctionBody
 75
 76
 77class SystemMessage(BaseModel):
 78    role: Literal["system"] = "system"
 79    content: str | list[TextContent]
 80
 81
 82class UserMessage(BaseModel):
 83    role: Literal["user"] = "user"
 84    content: str | list[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent]
 85
 86
 87class AssistantMessage(BaseModel):
 88    role: Literal["assistant"] = "assistant"
 89    content: Optional[str | list[TextContent]] = None
 90    name: Optional[str] = None
 91    tool_calls: Optional[list[FunctionData]] = None
 92
 93    # Non-OpenAI fields
 94    reasoning: Optional[list[TextContent]] = None
 95
 96
 97class ToolMessage(BaseModel):
 98    role: Literal["tool"] = "tool"
 99    content: str | list[TextContent]
100    tool_call_id: Optional[str] = None
101
102
103Message = Union[
104    SystemMessage,
105    UserMessage,
106    AssistantMessage,
107    ToolMessage,
108]
109
110
111class MessageOutput(BaseModel):
112    message: AssistantMessage
113    finish_reason: Optional[Literal["stop", "tool_calls", "invalid_tool_call", "length", "error"]] = None
114

116## Types for agent's responses
117
118_console = Console(highlight=False, force_jupyter=False, force_terminal=True)
119
120
121class AgentResponseOutputText(BaseModel):
122    type: Literal["output_text", "reasoning"]
123    role: Literal["assistant"] = "assistant"
124    is_type_switched: bool = False
125    content: str
126
127    def print(self):
128        if self.is_type_switched:
129            _console.print()  # add newline if type has been switched
130        _console.print(self.content, end="", style=("yellow" if self.type == "reasoning" else None))
131
132
133class AgentResponseToolCall(BaseModel):
134    type: Literal["tool_call"] = "tool_call"
135    role: Literal["assistant"] = "assistant"
136    is_type_switched: bool = False
137    content: FunctionData
138
139    def print(self):
140        title = f"[magenta]Tool Call[/magenta]: [bold]{self.content.function.name}[/bold]"
141        if self.content.id is not None and len(self.content.id) > 0:
142            title += f" ({self.content.id})"
143        panel = Panel(
144            json.dumps(self.content.function.arguments, indent=2),
145            title=title,
146            title_align="left",
147        )
148        _console.print(panel)
149
150
151class AgentResponseToolResult(BaseModel):
152    type: Literal["tool_call_result"] = "tool_call_result"
153    role: Literal["tool"] = "tool"
154    is_type_switched: bool = False
155    content: ToolMessage
156
157    def print(self):
158        try:
159            # Try to parse as json
160            content = json.dumps(json.loads(self.content.content[0].text), indent=2)
161        except json.JSONDecodeError:
162            # Use original content if not json deserializable
163            content = self.content.content[0].text
164        # Truncate long contents
165        if len(content) > 500:
166            content = content[:500] + "...(truncated)"
167
168        title = "[green]Tool Result[/green]"
169        if self.content.tool_call_id is not None and len(self.content.tool_call_id) > 0:
170            title += f" ({self.content.tool_call_id})"
171        panel = Panel(
172            content,
173            title=title,
174            title_align="left",
175        )
176        _console.print(panel)
177
178
179class AgentResponseError(BaseModel):
180    type: Literal["error"] = "error"
181    role: Literal["assistant"] = "assistant"
182    is_type_switched: bool = False
183    content: str
184
185    def print(self):
186        panel = Panel(
187            self.content,
188            title="[bold red]Error[/bold red]",
189        )
190        _console.print(panel)
191
192
193AgentResponse = Union[
194    AgentResponseOutputText,
195    AgentResponseToolCall,
196    AgentResponseToolResult,
197    AgentResponseError,
198]

200## Types and functions related to Tools
201
202ToolDefinition = Union["BuiltinToolDefinition", "RESTAPIToolDefinition"]
203
204
205class ToolDescription(BaseModel):
206    name: str
207    description: str
208    parameters: "ToolParameters"
209    return_type: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = Field(default=None, alias="return")
210    model_config = ConfigDict(populate_by_name=True)
211
212
213class ToolParameters(BaseModel):
214    type: Literal["object"]
215    properties: dict[str, "ToolParametersProperty"]
216    required: Optional[list[str]] = []
217
218
219class ToolParametersProperty(BaseModel):
220    type: Literal["string", "number", "boolean", "object", "array", "null"]
221    description: Optional[str] = None
222    model_config = ConfigDict(extra="allow")
223
224
225class BuiltinToolDefinition(BaseModel):
226    type: Literal["builtin"]
227    description: ToolDescription
228    behavior: "BuiltinToolBehavior"
229
230
231class BuiltinToolBehavior(BaseModel):
232    output_path: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, alias="outputPath")
233    model_config = ConfigDict(populate_by_name=True)
234
235
236class RESTAPIToolDefinition(BaseModel):
237    type: Literal["restapi"]
238    description: ToolDescription
239    behavior: "RESTAPIBehavior"
240
241
242class RESTAPIBehavior(BaseModel):
243    base_url: str = Field(alias="baseURL")
244    method: Literal["GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE"]
245    authentication: Optional[Literal["bearer"]] = None
246    headers: Optional[dict[str, str]] = None
247    body: Optional[str] = None
248    output_path: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, alias="outputPath")
249    model_config = ConfigDict(populate_by_name=True)
250
251
252class Tool:
253    def __init__(
254        self,
255        desc: ToolDescription,
256        call_fn: Callable[..., Any],
257    ):
258        self.desc = desc
259        self.call = call_fn
260
261
262class ToolAuthenticator(ABC):
263    def __call__(self, request: dict[str, Any]) -> dict[str, Any]:
264        return self.apply(request)
265
266    @abstractmethod
267    def apply(self, request: dict[str, Any]) -> dict[str, Any]:
268        pass
269
270
271class BearerAuthenticator(ToolAuthenticator):
272    def __init__(self, token: str, bearer_format: str = "Bearer"):
273        self.token = token
274        self.bearer_format = bearer_format
275
276    def apply(self, request: dict[str, Any]) -> dict[str, Any]:
277        headers = request.get("headers", {})
278        headers["Authorization"] = f"{self.bearer_format} {self.token}"
279        return {**request, "headers": headers}
280
281
282class Agent:
283    """
284    The `Agent` class provides a high-level interface for interacting with large language models (LLMs) in Ailoy.
285    It abstracts the underlying runtime and VM logic, allowing users to easily send queries and receive streaming
286    responses.
287
288    Agents can be extended with external tools or APIs to provide real-time or domain-specific knowledge, enabling
289    more powerful and context-aware interactions.
290    """
291
292    def __init__(
293        self,
294        runtime: Runtime,
295        model: APIModel | LocalModel,
296        system_message: Optional[str] = None,
297    ):
298        """
299        Create an instance.
300
301        :param runtime: The runtime environment associated with the agent.
302        :param model: The model instance.
303        :param system_message: Optional system message to set the initial assistant context.
304        :raises ValueError: If model name is not supported or validation fails.
305        """
306        self._runtime = runtime
307
308        # Initialize component state
309        self._component_name = generate_uuid()
310        self._component_ready = False
311
312        # Initialize messages
313        self._messages: list[Message] = []
314
315        # Initialize system message
316        self._system_message = system_message
317
318        # Initialize tools
319        self._tools: list[Tool] = []
320
321        # Initialize MCP servers
322        self._mcp_servers: list[MCPServer] = []
323
324        # Define the component
325        self.define(model)
326
327    def __del__(self):
328        self.delete()
329
330    def __enter__(self):
331        return self
332
333    def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback):
334        self.delete()
335
336    def define(self, model: APIModel | LocalModel) -> None:
337        """
338        Initializes the agent by defining its model in the runtime.
339        This must be called before running the agent. If already initialized, this is a no-op.
340        :param model: The model instance.
341        """
342        if self._component_ready:
343            return
344
345        if not self._runtime.is_alive():
346            raise ValueError("Runtime is currently stopped.")
347
348        # Set default system message if not given; still can be None
349        if self._system_message is None:
350            self._system_message = getattr(model, "default_system_message", None)
351
352        self.clear_messages()
353
354        # Call runtime's define
355        self._runtime.define(
356            model.component_type,
357            self._component_name,
358            model.to_attrs(),
359        )
360
361        # Mark as defined
362        self._component_ready = True
363
364    def delete(self) -> None:
365        """
366        Deinitializes the agent and releases resources in the runtime.
367        This should be called when the agent is no longer needed. If already deinitialized, this is a no-op.
368        """
369        if not self._component_ready:
370            return
371
372        if self._runtime.is_alive():
373            self._runtime.delete(self._component_name)
374
375        self.clear_messages()
376
377        for mcp_server in self._mcp_servers:
378            mcp_server.cleanup()
379
380        self._component_ready = False
381
382    def query(
383        self,
384        message: str | list[str | Image | dict | TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent],
385        reasoning: bool = False,
386    ) -> Generator[AgentResponse, None, None]:
387        """
388        Runs the agent with a new user message and yields streamed responses.
389
390        :param message: The user message to send to the model.
391        :param reasoning: If True, enables reasoning capabilities. (Default: False)
392        :return: An iterator over the output, where each item represents either a generated token from the assistant or a tool call.
393        :rtype: Iterator[:class:`AgentResponse`]
394        """  # noqa: E501
395        if not self._component_ready:
396            raise ValueError("Agent is not valid. Create one or define newly.")
397
398        if not self._runtime.is_alive():
399            raise ValueError("Runtime is currently stopped.")
400
401        if isinstance(message, str):
402            self._messages.append(UserMessage(content=[TextContent(text=message)]))
403        elif isinstance(message, list):
404            if len(message) == 0:
405                raise ValueError("Message is empty")
406
407            contents = []
408            for content in message:
409                if isinstance(content, str):
410                    contents.append(TextContent(text=content))
411                elif isinstance(content, Image):
412                    contents.append(ImageContent.from_pillow(image=content))
413                elif isinstance(content, dict):
414                    ta: TypeAdapter[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent] = TypeAdapter(
415                        Annotated[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent, Field(discriminator="type")]
416                    )
417                    validated_content = ta.validate_python(content)
418                    contents.append(validated_content)
419                else:
420                    contents.append(content)
421
422            self._messages.append(UserMessage(content=contents))
423        else:
424            raise ValueError(f"Invalid message type: {type(message)}")
425
426        prev_resp_type = None
427
428        while True:
429            infer_args = {
430                "messages": [msg.model_dump(exclude_none=True) for msg in self._messages],
431                "tools": [{"type": "function", "function": t.desc.model_dump(exclude_none=True)} for t in self._tools],
432            }
433            if reasoning:
434                infer_args["reasoning"] = reasoning
435
436            assistant_reasoning = None
437            assistant_content = None
438            assistant_tool_calls = None
439            finish_reason = ""
440            for result in self._runtime.call_iter_method(self._component_name, "infer", infer_args):
441                msg = MessageOutput.model_validate(result)
442
443                if msg.message.reasoning:
444                    for v in msg.message.reasoning:
445                        if not assistant_reasoning:
446                            assistant_reasoning = [v]
447                        else:
448                            assistant_reasoning[0].text += v.text
449                        resp = AgentResponseOutputText(
450                            type="reasoning",
451                            is_type_switched=(prev_resp_type != "reasoning"),
452                            content=v.text,
453                        )
454                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
455                        yield resp
456                if msg.message.content is not None:
457                    # Canonicalize message content to the array of TextContent
458                    if isinstance(msg.message.content, str):
459                        msg.message.content = [TextContent(text=msg.message.content)]
460
461                    for v in msg.message.content:
462                        if not assistant_content:
463                            assistant_content = [v]
464                        else:
465                            assistant_content[0].text += v.text
466                        resp = AgentResponseOutputText(
467                            type="output_text",
468                            is_type_switched=(prev_resp_type != "output_text"),
469                            content=v.text,
470                        )
471                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
472                        yield resp
473                if msg.message.tool_calls:
474                    for v in msg.message.tool_calls:
475                        if not assistant_tool_calls:
476                            assistant_tool_calls = [v]
477                        else:
478                            assistant_tool_calls.append(v)
479                        resp = AgentResponseToolCall(
480                            is_type_switched=True,
481                            content=v,
482                        )
483                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
484                        yield resp
485                if msg.finish_reason:
486                    finish_reason = msg.finish_reason
487                    break
488
489            # Append output
490            self._messages.append(
491                AssistantMessage(
492                    reasoning=assistant_reasoning,
493                    content=assistant_content,
494                    tool_calls=assistant_tool_calls,
495                )
496            )
497
498            if finish_reason == "tool_calls":
499
500                def run_tool(tool_call: FunctionData) -> ToolMessage:
501                    tool_ = next(
502                        (t for t in self._tools if t.desc.name == tool_call.function.name),
503                        None,
504                    )
505                    if not tool_:
506                        raise RuntimeError("Tool not found")
507                    tool_result = tool_.call(**tool_call.function.arguments)
508                    return ToolMessage(
509                        content=[TextContent(text=json.dumps(tool_result))],
510                        tool_call_id=tool_call.id,
511                    )
512
513                tool_call_results = [run_tool(tc) for tc in assistant_tool_calls]
514                for result_msg in tool_call_results:
515                    self._messages.append(result_msg)
516                    resp = AgentResponseToolResult(
517                        is_type_switched=True,
518                        content=result_msg,
519                    )
520                    prev_resp_type = resp.type
521                    yield resp
522                # Infer again if tool calls happened
523                continue
524
525            # Finish this generator
526            yield AgentResponseOutputText(type="output_text", content="\n")
527            break
528
529    def get_messages(self) -> list[Message]:
530        """
531        Get the current conversation history.
532        Each item in the list represents a message from either the user or the assistant.
533
534        :return: The conversation history so far in the form of a list.
535        :rtype: list[Message]
536        """
537        return self._messages
538
539    def clear_messages(self):
540        """
541        Clear the history of conversation messages.
542        """
543        self._messages.clear()
544        if self._system_message is not None:
545            self._messages.append(SystemMessage(role="system", content=[TextContent(text=self._system_message)]))
546
547    def print(self, resp: AgentResponse):
548        resp.print()
549
550    def add_tool(self, tool: Tool) -> None:
551        """
552        Adds a custom tool to the agent.
553
554        :param tool: Tool instance to be added.
555        """
556        if any(t.desc.name == tool.desc.name for t in self._tools):
557            warnings.warn(f'Tool "{tool.desc.name}" is already added.')
558            return
559        self._tools.append(tool)
560
561    def add_py_function_tool(self, f: Callable[..., Any], desc: Optional[dict] = None):
562        """
563        Adds a Python function as a tool using callable.
564
565        :param f: Function will be called when the tool invocation occured.
566        :param desc: Tool description to override. If not given, parsed from docstring of function `f`.
567
568        :raises ValueError: Docstring parsing is failed.
569        :raises ValidationError: Given or parsed description is not a valid `ToolDescription`.
570        """
571        tool_description = None
572        if desc is not None:
573            tool_description = ToolDescription.model_validate(desc)
574
575        if tool_description is None:
576            try:
577                json_schema = get_json_schema(f)
578            except (TypeHintParsingException, DocstringParsingException) as e:
579                raise ValueError("Failed to parse docstring", e)
580
581            tool_description = ToolDescription.model_validate(json_schema.get("function", {}))
582
583        self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_description, call_fn=f))
584
585    def add_builtin_tool(self, tool_def: BuiltinToolDefinition) -> bool:
586        """
587        Adds a built-in tool.
588
589        :param tool_def: The built-in tool definition.
590        :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
591        :raises ValueError: If the tool type is not "builtin" or required inputs are missing.
592        """
593        if tool_def.type != "builtin":
594            raise ValueError('Tool type is not "builtin"')
595
596        def call(**inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
597            required = tool_def.description.parameters.required or []
598            for param_name in required:
599                if param_name not in inputs:
600                    raise ValueError(f'Parameter "{param_name}" is required but not provided')
601
602            output = self._runtime.call(tool_def.description.name, inputs)
603            if tool_def.behavior.output_path is not None:
604                output = jmespath.search(tool_def.behavior.output_path, output)
605
606            return output
607
608        return self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_def.description, call_fn=call))
609
610    def add_restapi_tool(
611        self,
612        tool_def: RESTAPIToolDefinition,
613        authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None,
614    ) -> bool:
615        """
616        Adds a REST API tool that performs external HTTP requests.
617
618        :param tool_def: REST API tool definition.
619        :param authenticator: Optional authenticator to inject into the request.
620        :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
621        :raises ValueError: If the tool type is not "restapi".
622        """
623        if tool_def.type != "restapi":
624            raise ValueError('Tool type is not "restapi"')
625
626        behavior = tool_def.behavior
627
628        def call(**inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
629            def render_template(template: str, context: dict[str, Any]) -> tuple[str, list[str]]:
630                import re
631
632                variables = set()
633
634                def replacer(match: re.Match):
635                    key = match.group(1).strip()
636                    variables.add(key)
637                    return str(context.get(key, f"{{{key}}}"))
638
639                rendered_url = re.sub(r"\$\{\s*([^}\s]+)\s*\}", replacer, template)
640                return rendered_url, list(variables)
641
642            # Handle path parameters
643            url, path_vars = render_template(behavior.base_url, inputs)
644
645            # Handle body
646            if behavior.body is not None:
647                body, body_vars = render_template(behavior.body, inputs)
648            else:
649                body, body_vars = None, []
650
651            # Handle query parameters
652            query_params = {k: v for k, v in inputs.items() if k not in set(path_vars + body_vars)}
653
654            # Construct a full URL
655            full_url = urlunparse(urlparse(url)._replace(query=urlencode(query_params)))
656
657            # Construct a request payload
658            request = {
659                "url": full_url,
660                "method": behavior.method,
661                "headers": behavior.headers,
662            }
663            if body:
664                request["body"] = body
665
666            # Apply authentication
667            if callable(authenticator):
668                request = authenticator(request)
669
670            # Call HTTP request
671            output = None
672            resp = self._runtime.call("http_request", request)
673            output = json.loads(resp["body"])
674
675            # Parse output path if defined
676            if behavior.output_path is not None:
677                output = jmespath.search(tool_def.behavior.output_path, output)
678
679            return output
680
681        return self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_def.description, call_fn=call))
682
683    def add_tools_from_preset(
684        self, preset_name: str, authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None
685    ):
686        """
687        Loads tools from a predefined JSON preset file.
688
689        :param preset_name: Name of the tool preset.
690        :param authenticator: Optional authenticator to use for REST API tools.
691        :raises ValueError: If the preset file is not found.
692        """
693        tool_presets_path = Path(__file__).parent / "presets" / "tools"
694        preset_json = tool_presets_path / f"{preset_name}.json"
695        if not preset_json.exists():
696            raise ValueError(f'Tool preset "{preset_name}" does not exist')
697
698        data: dict[str, dict[str, Any]] = json.loads(preset_json.read_text())
699        for tool_name, tool_def in data.items():
700            tool_type = tool_def.get("type", None)
701            if tool_type == "builtin":
702                self.add_builtin_tool(BuiltinToolDefinition.model_validate(tool_def))
703            elif tool_type == "restapi":
704                self.add_restapi_tool(RESTAPIToolDefinition.model_validate(tool_def), authenticator=authenticator)
705            else:
706                warnings.warn(f'Tool type "{tool_type}" is not supported. Skip adding tool "{tool_name}".')
707
708    def add_tools_from_mcp_server(
709        self, name: str, params: StdioServerParameters, tools_to_add: Optional[list[str]] = None
710    ):
711        """
712        Create a MCP server and register its tools to agent.
713
714        :param name: The unique name of the MCP server.
715                     If there's already a MCP server with the same name, it raises RuntimeError.
716        :param params: Parameters for connecting to the MCP stdio server.
717        :param tools_to_add: Optional list of tool names to add. If None, all tools are added.
718        """
719        if any([s.name == name for s in self._mcp_servers]):
720            raise RuntimeError(f"MCP server with name '{name}' is already registered")
721
722        # Create and register MCP server
723        mcp_server = MCPServer(name, params)
724        self._mcp_servers.append(mcp_server)
725
726        # Register tools
727        for tool in mcp_server.list_tools():
728            # Skip if this tool is not in the whitelist
729            if tools_to_add is not None and tool.name not in tools_to_add:
730                continue
731
732            desc = ToolDescription(
733                name=f"{name}-{tool.name}", description=tool.description, parameters=tool.inputSchema
734            )
735
736            def call(tool: MCPTool, **inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> list[str]:
737                return mcp_server.call_tool(tool, inputs)
738
739            self.add_tool(Tool(desc=desc, call_fn=partial(call, tool)))
740
741    def remove_mcp_server(self, name: str):
742        """
743        Removes the MCP server and its tools from the agent, with terminating the MCP server process.
744
745        :param name: The unique name of the MCP server.
746                     If there's no MCP server matches the name, it raises RuntimeError.
747        """
748        if all([s.name != name for s in self._mcp_servers]):
749            raise RuntimeError(f"MCP server with name '{name}' does not exist")
750
751        # Remove the MCP server
752        mcp_server = next(filter(lambda s: s.name == name, self._mcp_servers))
753        self._mcp_servers.remove(mcp_server)
754        mcp_server.cleanup()
755
756        # Remove tools registered from the MCP server
757        self._tools = list(filter(lambda t: not t.desc.name.startswith(f"{mcp_server.name}-"), self._tools))
758
759    def get_tools(self):
760        """
761        Get the list of registered tools.
762        """
763        return self._tools
764
765    def clear_tools(self):
766        """
767        Clear the registered tools.
768        """
769        self._tools.clear()

A base class for creating Pydantic models.

Attributes: __class_vars__: The names of the class variables defined on the model. __private_attributes__: Metadata about the private attributes of the model. __signature__: The synthesized __init__ [Signature][inspect.Signature] of the model.

__pydantic_complete__: Whether model building is completed, or if there are still undefined fields.
__pydantic_core_schema__: The core schema of the model.
__pydantic_custom_init__: Whether the model has a custom `__init__` function.
__pydantic_decorators__: Metadata containing the decorators defined on the model.
    This replaces `Model.__validators__` and `Model.__root_validators__` from Pydantic V1.
__pydantic_generic_metadata__: Metadata for generic models; contains data used for a similar purpose to
    __args__, __origin__, __parameters__ in typing-module generics. May eventually be replaced by these.
__pydantic_parent_namespace__: Parent namespace of the model, used for automatic rebuilding of models.
__pydantic_post_init__: The name of the post-init method for the model, if defined.
__pydantic_root_model__: Whether the model is a [`RootModel`][pydantic.root_model.RootModel].
__pydantic_serializer__: The `pydantic-core` `SchemaSerializer` used to dump instances of the model.
__pydantic_validator__: The `pydantic-core` `SchemaValidator` used to validate instances of the model.

__pydantic_fields__: A dictionary of field names and their corresponding [`FieldInfo`][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo] objects.
__pydantic_computed_fields__: A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding [`ComputedFieldInfo`][pydantic.fields.ComputedFieldInfo] objects.

__pydantic_extra__: A dictionary containing extra values, if [`extra`][pydantic.config.ConfigDict.extra]
    is set to `'allow'`.
__pydantic_fields_set__: The names of fields explicitly set during instantiation.
__pydantic_private__: Values of private attributes set on the model instance.
type: Literal['text']
text: str

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

!!! abstract "Usage Documentation" Models

A base class for creating Pydantic models.

Attributes: __class_vars__: The names of the class variables defined on the model. __private_attributes__: Metadata about the private attributes of the model. __signature__: The synthesized __init__ [Signature][inspect.Signature] of the model.

__pydantic_complete__: Whether model building is completed, or if there are still undefined fields.
__pydantic_core_schema__: The core schema of the model.
__pydantic_custom_init__: Whether the model has a custom `__init__` function.
__pydantic_decorators__: Metadata containing the decorators defined on the model.
    This replaces `Model.__validators__` and `Model.__root_validators__` from Pydantic V1.
__pydantic_generic_metadata__: Metadata for generic models; contains data used for a similar purpose to
    __args__, __origin__, __parameters__ in typing-module generics. May eventually be replaced by these.
__pydantic_parent_namespace__: Parent namespace of the model, used for automatic rebuilding of models.
__pydantic_post_init__: The name of the post-init method for the model, if defined.
__pydantic_root_model__: Whether the model is a [`RootModel`][pydantic.root_model.RootModel].
__pydantic_serializer__: The `pydantic-core` `SchemaSerializer` used to dump instances of the model.
__pydantic_validator__: The `pydantic-core` `SchemaValidator` used to validate instances of the model.

__pydantic_fields__: A dictionary of field names and their corresponding [`FieldInfo`][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo] objects.
__pydantic_computed_fields__: A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding [`ComputedFieldInfo`][pydantic.fields.ComputedFieldInfo] objects.

__pydantic_extra__: A dictionary containing extra values, if [`extra`][pydantic.config.ConfigDict.extra]
    is set to `'allow'`.
__pydantic_fields_set__: The names of fields explicitly set during instantiation.
__pydantic_private__: Values of private attributes set on the model instance.
role: Literal['assistant']
content: Union[str, list[TextContent], NoneType]
name: Optional[str]
tool_calls: Optional[list[FunctionData]]
reasoning: Optional[list[TextContent]]
model_config: ClassVar[pydantic.config.ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class AgentResponseOutputText(pydantic.main.BaseModel): 
122class AgentResponseOutputText(BaseModel):
123    type: Literal["output_text", "reasoning"]
124    role: Literal["assistant"] = "assistant"
125    is_type_switched: bool = False
126    content: str
127
128    def print(self):
129        if self.is_type_switched:
130            _console.print()  # add newline if type has been switched
131        _console.print(self.content, end="", style=("yellow" if self.type == "reasoning" else None))

class AgentResponseToolCall(pydantic.main.BaseModel): 
134class AgentResponseToolCall(BaseModel):
135    type: Literal["tool_call"] = "tool_call"
136    role: Literal["assistant"] = "assistant"
137    is_type_switched: bool = False
138    content: FunctionData
139
140    def print(self):
141        title = f"[magenta]Tool Call[/magenta]: [bold]{self.content.function.name}[/bold]"
142        if self.content.id is not None and len(self.content.id) > 0:
143            title += f" ({self.content.id})"
144        panel = Panel(
145            json.dumps(self.content.function.arguments, indent=2),
146            title=title,
147            title_align="left",
148        )
149        _console.print(panel)

class AgentResponseToolResult(pydantic.main.BaseModel): 
152class AgentResponseToolResult(BaseModel):
153    type: Literal["tool_call_result"] = "tool_call_result"
154    role: Literal["tool"] = "tool"
155    is_type_switched: bool = False
156    content: ToolMessage
157
158    def print(self):
159        try:
160            # Try to parse as json
161            content = json.dumps(json.loads(self.content.content[0].text), indent=2)
162        except json.JSONDecodeError:
163            # Use original content if not json deserializable
164            content = self.content.content[0].text
165        # Truncate long contents
166        if len(content) > 500:
167            content = content[:500] + "...(truncated)"
168
169        title = "[green]Tool Result[/green]"
170        if self.content.tool_call_id is not None and len(self.content.tool_call_id) > 0:
171            title += f" ({self.content.tool_call_id})"
172        panel = Panel(
173            content,
174            title=title,
175            title_align="left",
176        )
177        _console.print(panel)

    is set to `'allow'`.
__pydantic_fields_set__: The names of fields explicitly set during instantiation.
__pydantic_private__: Values of private attributes set on the model instance.
type: Literal['string', 'number', 'boolean', 'object', 'array', 'null']
description: Optional[str]
model_config = {'extra': 'allow'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class ToolAuthenticator(abc.ABC):

265        return self.apply(request)

class BearerAuthenticator(ToolAuthenticator): 
272class BearerAuthenticator(ToolAuthenticator):
273    def __init__(self, token: str, bearer_format: str = "Bearer"):
274        self.token = token
275        self.bearer_format = bearer_format
276
277    def apply(self, request: dict[str, Any]) -> dict[str, Any]:
278        headers = request.get("headers", {})
279        headers["Authorization"] = f"{self.bearer_format} {self.token}"
280        return {**request, "headers": headers}

278        headers = request.get("headers", {})

class Agent: 
283class Agent:
284    """
285    The `Agent` class provides a high-level interface for interacting with large language models (LLMs) in Ailoy.
286    It abstracts the underlying runtime and VM logic, allowing users to easily send queries and receive streaming
287    responses.
288
289    Agents can be extended with external tools or APIs to provide real-time or domain-specific knowledge, enabling
290    more powerful and context-aware interactions.
291    """
292
293    def __init__(
294        self,
295        runtime: Runtime,
296        model: APIModel | LocalModel,
297        system_message: Optional[str] = None,
298    ):
299        """
300        Create an instance.
301
302        :param runtime: The runtime environment associated with the agent.
303        :param model: The model instance.
304        :param system_message: Optional system message to set the initial assistant context.
305        :raises ValueError: If model name is not supported or validation fails.
306        """
307        self._runtime = runtime
308
309        # Initialize component state
310        self._component_name = generate_uuid()
311        self._component_ready = False
312
313        # Initialize messages
314        self._messages: list[Message] = []
315
316        # Initialize system message
317        self._system_message = system_message
318
319        # Initialize tools
320        self._tools: list[Tool] = []
321
322        # Initialize MCP servers
323        self._mcp_servers: list[MCPServer] = []
324
325        # Define the component
326        self.define(model)
327
328    def __del__(self):
329        self.delete()
330
331    def __enter__(self):
332        return self
333
334    def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback):
335        self.delete()
336
337    def define(self, model: APIModel | LocalModel) -> None:
338        """
339        Initializes the agent by defining its model in the runtime.
340        This must be called before running the agent. If already initialized, this is a no-op.
341        :param model: The model instance.
342        """
343        if self._component_ready:
344            return
345
346        if not self._runtime.is_alive():
347            raise ValueError("Runtime is currently stopped.")
348
349        # Set default system message if not given; still can be None
350        if self._system_message is None:
351            self._system_message = getattr(model, "default_system_message", None)
352
353        self.clear_messages()
354
355        # Call runtime's define
356        self._runtime.define(
357            model.component_type,
358            self._component_name,
359            model.to_attrs(),
360        )
361
362        # Mark as defined
363        self._component_ready = True
364
365    def delete(self) -> None:
366        """
367        Deinitializes the agent and releases resources in the runtime.
368        This should be called when the agent is no longer needed. If already deinitialized, this is a no-op.
369        """
370        if not self._component_ready:
371            return
372
373        if self._runtime.is_alive():
374            self._runtime.delete(self._component_name)
375
376        self.clear_messages()
377
378        for mcp_server in self._mcp_servers:
379            mcp_server.cleanup()
380
381        self._component_ready = False
382
383    def query(
384        self,
385        message: str | list[str | Image | dict | TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent],
386        reasoning: bool = False,
387    ) -> Generator[AgentResponse, None, None]:
388        """
389        Runs the agent with a new user message and yields streamed responses.
390
391        :param message: The user message to send to the model.
392        :param reasoning: If True, enables reasoning capabilities. (Default: False)
393        :return: An iterator over the output, where each item represents either a generated token from the assistant or a tool call.
394        :rtype: Iterator[:class:`AgentResponse`]
395        """  # noqa: E501
396        if not self._component_ready:
397            raise ValueError("Agent is not valid. Create one or define newly.")
398
399        if not self._runtime.is_alive():
400            raise ValueError("Runtime is currently stopped.")
401
402        if isinstance(message, str):
403            self._messages.append(UserMessage(content=[TextContent(text=message)]))
404        elif isinstance(message, list):
405            if len(message) == 0:
406                raise ValueError("Message is empty")
407
408            contents = []
409            for content in message:
410                if isinstance(content, str):
411                    contents.append(TextContent(text=content))
412                elif isinstance(content, Image):
413                    contents.append(ImageContent.from_pillow(image=content))
414                elif isinstance(content, dict):
415                    ta: TypeAdapter[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent] = TypeAdapter(
416                        Annotated[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent, Field(discriminator="type")]
417                    )
418                    validated_content = ta.validate_python(content)
419                    contents.append(validated_content)
420                else:
421                    contents.append(content)
422
423            self._messages.append(UserMessage(content=contents))
424        else:
425            raise ValueError(f"Invalid message type: {type(message)}")
426
427        prev_resp_type = None
428
429        while True:
430            infer_args = {
431                "messages": [msg.model_dump(exclude_none=True) for msg in self._messages],
432                "tools": [{"type": "function", "function": t.desc.model_dump(exclude_none=True)} for t in self._tools],
433            }
434            if reasoning:
435                infer_args["reasoning"] = reasoning
436
437            assistant_reasoning = None
438            assistant_content = None
439            assistant_tool_calls = None
440            finish_reason = ""
441            for result in self._runtime.call_iter_method(self._component_name, "infer", infer_args):
442                msg = MessageOutput.model_validate(result)
443
444                if msg.message.reasoning:
445                    for v in msg.message.reasoning:
446                        if not assistant_reasoning:
447                            assistant_reasoning = [v]
448                        else:
449                            assistant_reasoning[0].text += v.text
450                        resp = AgentResponseOutputText(
451                            type="reasoning",
452                            is_type_switched=(prev_resp_type != "reasoning"),
453                            content=v.text,
454                        )
455                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
456                        yield resp
457                if msg.message.content is not None:
458                    # Canonicalize message content to the array of TextContent
459                    if isinstance(msg.message.content, str):
460                        msg.message.content = [TextContent(text=msg.message.content)]
461
462                    for v in msg.message.content:
463                        if not assistant_content:
464                            assistant_content = [v]
465                        else:
466                            assistant_content[0].text += v.text
467                        resp = AgentResponseOutputText(
468                            type="output_text",
469                            is_type_switched=(prev_resp_type != "output_text"),
470                            content=v.text,
471                        )
472                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
473                        yield resp
474                if msg.message.tool_calls:
475                    for v in msg.message.tool_calls:
476                        if not assistant_tool_calls:
477                            assistant_tool_calls = [v]
478                        else:
479                            assistant_tool_calls.append(v)
480                        resp = AgentResponseToolCall(
481                            is_type_switched=True,
482                            content=v,
483                        )
484                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
485                        yield resp
486                if msg.finish_reason:
487                    finish_reason = msg.finish_reason
488                    break
489
490            # Append output
491            self._messages.append(
492                AssistantMessage(
493                    reasoning=assistant_reasoning,
494                    content=assistant_content,
495                    tool_calls=assistant_tool_calls,
496                )
497            )
498
499            if finish_reason == "tool_calls":
500
501                def run_tool(tool_call: FunctionData) -> ToolMessage:
502                    tool_ = next(
503                        (t for t in self._tools if t.desc.name == tool_call.function.name),
504                        None,
505                    )
506                    if not tool_:
507                        raise RuntimeError("Tool not found")
508                    tool_result = tool_.call(**tool_call.function.arguments)
509                    return ToolMessage(
510                        content=[TextContent(text=json.dumps(tool_result))],
511                        tool_call_id=tool_call.id,
512                    )
513
514                tool_call_results = [run_tool(tc) for tc in assistant_tool_calls]
515                for result_msg in tool_call_results:
516                    self._messages.append(result_msg)
517                    resp = AgentResponseToolResult(
518                        is_type_switched=True,
519                        content=result_msg,
520                    )
521                    prev_resp_type = resp.type
522                    yield resp
523                # Infer again if tool calls happened
524                continue
525
526            # Finish this generator
527            yield AgentResponseOutputText(type="output_text", content="\n")
528            break
529
530    def get_messages(self) -> list[Message]:
531        """
532        Get the current conversation history.
533        Each item in the list represents a message from either the user or the assistant.
534
535        :return: The conversation history so far in the form of a list.
536        :rtype: list[Message]
537        """
538        return self._messages
539
540    def clear_messages(self):
541        """
542        Clear the history of conversation messages.
543        """
544        self._messages.clear()
545        if self._system_message is not None:
546            self._messages.append(SystemMessage(role="system", content=[TextContent(text=self._system_message)]))
547
548    def print(self, resp: AgentResponse):
549        resp.print()
550
551    def add_tool(self, tool: Tool) -> None:
552        """
553        Adds a custom tool to the agent.
554
555        :param tool: Tool instance to be added.
556        """
557        if any(t.desc.name == tool.desc.name for t in self._tools):
558            warnings.warn(f'Tool "{tool.desc.name}" is already added.')
559            return
560        self._tools.append(tool)
561
562    def add_py_function_tool(self, f: Callable[..., Any], desc: Optional[dict] = None):
563        """
564        Adds a Python function as a tool using callable.
565
566        :param f: Function will be called when the tool invocation occured.
567        :param desc: Tool description to override. If not given, parsed from docstring of function `f`.
568
569        :raises ValueError: Docstring parsing is failed.
570        :raises ValidationError: Given or parsed description is not a valid `ToolDescription`.
571        """
572        tool_description = None
573        if desc is not None:
574            tool_description = ToolDescription.model_validate(desc)
575
576        if tool_description is None:
577            try:
578                json_schema = get_json_schema(f)
579            except (TypeHintParsingException, DocstringParsingException) as e:
580                raise ValueError("Failed to parse docstring", e)
581
582            tool_description = ToolDescription.model_validate(json_schema.get("function", {}))
583
584        self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_description, call_fn=f))
585
586    def add_builtin_tool(self, tool_def: BuiltinToolDefinition) -> bool:
587        """
588        Adds a built-in tool.
589
590        :param tool_def: The built-in tool definition.
591        :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
592        :raises ValueError: If the tool type is not "builtin" or required inputs are missing.
593        """
594        if tool_def.type != "builtin":
595            raise ValueError('Tool type is not "builtin"')
596
597        def call(**inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
598            required = tool_def.description.parameters.required or []
599            for param_name in required:
600                if param_name not in inputs:
601                    raise ValueError(f'Parameter "{param_name}" is required but not provided')
602
603            output = self._runtime.call(tool_def.description.name, inputs)
604            if tool_def.behavior.output_path is not None:
605                output = jmespath.search(tool_def.behavior.output_path, output)
606
607            return output
608
609        return self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_def.description, call_fn=call))
610
611    def add_restapi_tool(
612        self,
613        tool_def: RESTAPIToolDefinition,
614        authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None,
615    ) -> bool:
616        """
617        Adds a REST API tool that performs external HTTP requests.
618
619        :param tool_def: REST API tool definition.
620        :param authenticator: Optional authenticator to inject into the request.
621        :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
622        :raises ValueError: If the tool type is not "restapi".
623        """
624        if tool_def.type != "restapi":
625            raise ValueError('Tool type is not "restapi"')
626
627        behavior = tool_def.behavior
628
629        def call(**inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
630            def render_template(template: str, context: dict[str, Any]) -> tuple[str, list[str]]:
631                import re
632
633                variables = set()
634
635                def replacer(match: re.Match):
636                    key = match.group(1).strip()
637                    variables.add(key)
638                    return str(context.get(key, f"{{{key}}}"))
639
640                rendered_url = re.sub(r"\$\{\s*([^}\s]+)\s*\}", replacer, template)
641                return rendered_url, list(variables)
642
643            # Handle path parameters
644            url, path_vars = render_template(behavior.base_url, inputs)
645
646            # Handle body
647            if behavior.body is not None:
648                body, body_vars = render_template(behavior.body, inputs)
649            else:
650                body, body_vars = None, []
651
652            # Handle query parameters
653            query_params = {k: v for k, v in inputs.items() if k not in set(path_vars + body_vars)}
654
655            # Construct a full URL
656            full_url = urlunparse(urlparse(url)._replace(query=urlencode(query_params)))
657
658            # Construct a request payload
659            request = {
660                "url": full_url,
661                "method": behavior.method,
662                "headers": behavior.headers,
663            }
664            if body:
665                request["body"] = body
666
667            # Apply authentication
668            if callable(authenticator):
669                request = authenticator(request)
670
671            # Call HTTP request
672            output = None
673            resp = self._runtime.call("http_request", request)
674            output = json.loads(resp["body"])
675
676            # Parse output path if defined
677            if behavior.output_path is not None:
678                output = jmespath.search(tool_def.behavior.output_path, output)
679
680            return output
681
682        return self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_def.description, call_fn=call))
683
684    def add_tools_from_preset(
685        self, preset_name: str, authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None
686    ):
687        """
688        Loads tools from a predefined JSON preset file.
689
690        :param preset_name: Name of the tool preset.
691        :param authenticator: Optional authenticator to use for REST API tools.
692        :raises ValueError: If the preset file is not found.
693        """
694        tool_presets_path = Path(__file__).parent / "presets" / "tools"
695        preset_json = tool_presets_path / f"{preset_name}.json"
696        if not preset_json.exists():
697            raise ValueError(f'Tool preset "{preset_name}" does not exist')
698
699        data: dict[str, dict[str, Any]] = json.loads(preset_json.read_text())
700        for tool_name, tool_def in data.items():
701            tool_type = tool_def.get("type", None)
702            if tool_type == "builtin":
703                self.add_builtin_tool(BuiltinToolDefinition.model_validate(tool_def))
704            elif tool_type == "restapi":
705                self.add_restapi_tool(RESTAPIToolDefinition.model_validate(tool_def), authenticator=authenticator)
706            else:
707                warnings.warn(f'Tool type "{tool_type}" is not supported. Skip adding tool "{tool_name}".')
708
709    def add_tools_from_mcp_server(
710        self, name: str, params: StdioServerParameters, tools_to_add: Optional[list[str]] = None
711    ):
712        """
713        Create a MCP server and register its tools to agent.
714
715        :param name: The unique name of the MCP server.
716                     If there's already a MCP server with the same name, it raises RuntimeError.
717        :param params: Parameters for connecting to the MCP stdio server.
718        :param tools_to_add: Optional list of tool names to add. If None, all tools are added.
719        """
720        if any([s.name == name for s in self._mcp_servers]):
721            raise RuntimeError(f"MCP server with name '{name}' is already registered")
722
723        # Create and register MCP server
724        mcp_server = MCPServer(name, params)
725        self._mcp_servers.append(mcp_server)
726
727        # Register tools
728        for tool in mcp_server.list_tools():
729            # Skip if this tool is not in the whitelist
730            if tools_to_add is not None and tool.name not in tools_to_add:
731                continue
732
733            desc = ToolDescription(
734                name=f"{name}-{tool.name}", description=tool.description, parameters=tool.inputSchema
735            )
736
737            def call(tool: MCPTool, **inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> list[str]:
738                return mcp_server.call_tool(tool, inputs)
739
740            self.add_tool(Tool(desc=desc, call_fn=partial(call, tool)))
741
742    def remove_mcp_server(self, name: str):
743        """
744        Removes the MCP server and its tools from the agent, with terminating the MCP server process.
745
746        :param name: The unique name of the MCP server.
747                     If there's no MCP server matches the name, it raises RuntimeError.
748        """
749        if all([s.name != name for s in self._mcp_servers]):
750            raise RuntimeError(f"MCP server with name '{name}' does not exist")
751
752        # Remove the MCP server
753        mcp_server = next(filter(lambda s: s.name == name, self._mcp_servers))
754        self._mcp_servers.remove(mcp_server)
755        mcp_server.cleanup()
756
757        # Remove tools registered from the MCP server
758        self._tools = list(filter(lambda t: not t.desc.name.startswith(f"{mcp_server.name}-"), self._tools))
759
760    def get_tools(self):
761        """
762        Get the list of registered tools.
763        """
764        return self._tools
765
766    def clear_tools(self):
767        """
768        Clear the registered tools.
769        """
770        self._tools.clear()

The Agent class provides a high-level interface for interacting with large language models (LLMs) in Ailoy. It abstracts the underlying runtime and VM logic, allowing users to easily send queries and receive streaming responses.

Agents can be extended with external tools or APIs to provide real-time or domain-specific knowledge, enabling more powerful and context-aware interactions.

Agent( runtime: ailoy.runtime.Runtime, model: ailoy.models.APIModel | ailoy.models.LocalModel, system_message: Optional[str] = None) 
293    def __init__(
294        self,
295        runtime: Runtime,
296        model: APIModel | LocalModel,
297        system_message: Optional[str] = None,
298    ):
299        """
300        Create an instance.
301
302        :param runtime: The runtime environment associated with the agent.
303        :param model: The model instance.
304        :param system_message: Optional system message to set the initial assistant context.
305        :raises ValueError: If model name is not supported or validation fails.
306        """
307        self._runtime = runtime
308
309        # Initialize component state
310        self._component_name = generate_uuid()
311        self._component_ready = False
312
313        # Initialize messages
314        self._messages: list[Message] = []
315
316        # Initialize system message
317        self._system_message = system_message
318
319        # Initialize tools
320        self._tools: list[Tool] = []
321
322        # Initialize MCP servers
323        self._mcp_servers: list[MCPServer] = []
324
325        # Define the component
326        self.define(model)

Create an instance.

Parameters
  • runtime: The runtime environment associated with the agent.
  • model: The model instance.
  • system_message: Optional system message to set the initial assistant context.
Raises
  • ValueError: If model name is not supported or validation fails.
def define( self, model: ailoy.models.APIModel | ailoy.models.LocalModel) -> None: 
337    def define(self, model: APIModel | LocalModel) -> None:
338        """
339        Initializes the agent by defining its model in the runtime.
340        This must be called before running the agent. If already initialized, this is a no-op.
341        :param model: The model instance.
342        """
343        if self._component_ready:
344            return
345
346        if not self._runtime.is_alive():
347            raise ValueError("Runtime is currently stopped.")
348
349        # Set default system message if not given; still can be None
350        if self._system_message is None:
351            self._system_message = getattr(model, "default_system_message", None)
352
353        self.clear_messages()
354
355        # Call runtime's define
356        self._runtime.define(
357            model.component_type,
358            self._component_name,
359            model.to_attrs(),
360        )
361
362        # Mark as defined
363        self._component_ready = True

Initializes the agent by defining its model in the runtime. This must be called before running the agent. If already initialized, this is a no-op.

Parameters
  • model: The model instance.
def delete(self) -> None: 
365    def delete(self) -> None:
366        """
367        Deinitializes the agent and releases resources in the runtime.
368        This should be called when the agent is no longer needed. If already deinitialized, this is a no-op.
369        """
370        if not self._component_ready:
371            return
372
373        if self._runtime.is_alive():
374            self._runtime.delete(self._component_name)
375
376        self.clear_messages()
377
378        for mcp_server in self._mcp_servers:
379            mcp_server.cleanup()
380
381        self._component_ready = False

Deinitializes the agent and releases resources in the runtime. This should be called when the agent is no longer needed. If already deinitialized, this is a no-op.

def query( self, message: str | list[str | PIL.Image.Image | dict | TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent], reasoning: bool = False) -> Generator[typing.Union[AgentResponseOutputText, AgentResponseToolCall, AgentResponseToolResult, AgentResponseError], None, None]: 
383    def query(
384        self,
385        message: str | list[str | Image | dict | TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent],
386        reasoning: bool = False,
387    ) -> Generator[AgentResponse, None, None]:
388        """
389        Runs the agent with a new user message and yields streamed responses.
390
391        :param message: The user message to send to the model.
392        :param reasoning: If True, enables reasoning capabilities. (Default: False)
393        :return: An iterator over the output, where each item represents either a generated token from the assistant or a tool call.
394        :rtype: Iterator[:class:`AgentResponse`]
395        """  # noqa: E501
396        if not self._component_ready:
397            raise ValueError("Agent is not valid. Create one or define newly.")
398
399        if not self._runtime.is_alive():
400            raise ValueError("Runtime is currently stopped.")
401
402        if isinstance(message, str):
403            self._messages.append(UserMessage(content=[TextContent(text=message)]))
404        elif isinstance(message, list):
405            if len(message) == 0:
406                raise ValueError("Message is empty")
407
408            contents = []
409            for content in message:
410                if isinstance(content, str):
411                    contents.append(TextContent(text=content))
412                elif isinstance(content, Image):
413                    contents.append(ImageContent.from_pillow(image=content))
414                elif isinstance(content, dict):
415                    ta: TypeAdapter[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent] = TypeAdapter(
416                        Annotated[TextContent | ImageContent | AudioContent, Field(discriminator="type")]
417                    )
418                    validated_content = ta.validate_python(content)
419                    contents.append(validated_content)
420                else:
421                    contents.append(content)
422
423            self._messages.append(UserMessage(content=contents))
424        else:
425            raise ValueError(f"Invalid message type: {type(message)}")
426
427        prev_resp_type = None
428
429        while True:
430            infer_args = {
431                "messages": [msg.model_dump(exclude_none=True) for msg in self._messages],
432                "tools": [{"type": "function", "function": t.desc.model_dump(exclude_none=True)} for t in self._tools],
433            }
434            if reasoning:
435                infer_args["reasoning"] = reasoning
436
437            assistant_reasoning = None
438            assistant_content = None
439            assistant_tool_calls = None
440            finish_reason = ""
441            for result in self._runtime.call_iter_method(self._component_name, "infer", infer_args):
442                msg = MessageOutput.model_validate(result)
443
444                if msg.message.reasoning:
445                    for v in msg.message.reasoning:
446                        if not assistant_reasoning:
447                            assistant_reasoning = [v]
448                        else:
449                            assistant_reasoning[0].text += v.text
450                        resp = AgentResponseOutputText(
451                            type="reasoning",
452                            is_type_switched=(prev_resp_type != "reasoning"),
453                            content=v.text,
454                        )
455                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
456                        yield resp
457                if msg.message.content is not None:
458                    # Canonicalize message content to the array of TextContent
459                    if isinstance(msg.message.content, str):
460                        msg.message.content = [TextContent(text=msg.message.content)]
461
462                    for v in msg.message.content:
463                        if not assistant_content:
464                            assistant_content = [v]
465                        else:
466                            assistant_content[0].text += v.text
467                        resp = AgentResponseOutputText(
468                            type="output_text",
469                            is_type_switched=(prev_resp_type != "output_text"),
470                            content=v.text,
471                        )
472                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
473                        yield resp
474                if msg.message.tool_calls:
475                    for v in msg.message.tool_calls:
476                        if not assistant_tool_calls:
477                            assistant_tool_calls = [v]
478                        else:
479                            assistant_tool_calls.append(v)
480                        resp = AgentResponseToolCall(
481                            is_type_switched=True,
482                            content=v,
483                        )
484                        prev_resp_type = resp.type
485                        yield resp
486                if msg.finish_reason:
487                    finish_reason = msg.finish_reason
488                    break
489
490            # Append output
491            self._messages.append(
492                AssistantMessage(
493                    reasoning=assistant_reasoning,
494                    content=assistant_content,
495                    tool_calls=assistant_tool_calls,
496                )
497            )
498
499            if finish_reason == "tool_calls":
500
501                def run_tool(tool_call: FunctionData) -> ToolMessage:
502                    tool_ = next(
503                        (t for t in self._tools if t.desc.name == tool_call.function.name),
504                        None,
505                    )
506                    if not tool_:
507                        raise RuntimeError("Tool not found")
508                    tool_result = tool_.call(**tool_call.function.arguments)
509                    return ToolMessage(
510                        content=[TextContent(text=json.dumps(tool_result))],
511                        tool_call_id=tool_call.id,
512                    )
513
514                tool_call_results = [run_tool(tc) for tc in assistant_tool_calls]
515                for result_msg in tool_call_results:
516                    self._messages.append(result_msg)
517                    resp = AgentResponseToolResult(
518                        is_type_switched=True,
519                        content=result_msg,
520                    )
521                    prev_resp_type = resp.type
522                    yield resp
523                # Infer again if tool calls happened
524                continue
525
526            # Finish this generator
527            yield AgentResponseOutputText(type="output_text", content="\n")
528            break

Runs the agent with a new user message and yields streamed responses.

Parameters
  • message: The user message to send to the model.
  • reasoning: If True, enables reasoning capabilities. (Default: False)
Returns

An iterator over the output, where each item represents either a generated token from the assistant or a tool call.

531        """
532        Get the current conversation history.
533        Each item in the list represents a message from either the user or the assistant.
534

536        :rtype: list[Message]
537        """

546            self._messages.append(SystemMessage(role="system", content=[TextContent(text=self._system_message)]))

def add_tool(self, tool: Tool) -> None: 
551    def add_tool(self, tool: Tool) -> None:
552        """
553        Adds a custom tool to the agent.
554
555        :param tool: Tool instance to be added.
556        """
557        if any(t.desc.name == tool.desc.name for t in self._tools):
558            warnings.warn(f'Tool "{tool.desc.name}" is already added.')
559            return
560        self._tools.append(tool)

Adds a custom tool to the agent.

  • tool: Tool instance to be added.
def add_py_function_tool(self, f: Callable[..., typing.Any], desc: Optional[dict] = None): 
562    def add_py_function_tool(self, f: Callable[..., Any], desc: Optional[dict] = None):
563        """
564        Adds a Python function as a tool using callable.
565
566        :param f: Function will be called when the tool invocation occured.
567        :param desc: Tool description to override. If not given, parsed from docstring of function `f`.
568
569        :raises ValueError: Docstring parsing is failed.
570        :raises ValidationError: Given or parsed description is not a valid `ToolDescription`.
571        """
572        tool_description = None
573        if desc is not None:
574            tool_description = ToolDescription.model_validate(desc)
575
576        if tool_description is None:
577            try:
578                json_schema = get_json_schema(f)
579            except (TypeHintParsingException, DocstringParsingException) as e:
580                raise ValueError("Failed to parse docstring", e)
581
582            tool_description = ToolDescription.model_validate(json_schema.get("function", {}))
583
584        self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_description, call_fn=f))

Adds a Python function as a tool using callable.

Parameters
  • f: Function will be called when the tool invocation occured.
  • desc: Tool description to override. If not given, parsed from docstring of function f.
Raises
  • ValueError: Docstring parsing is failed.
  • ValidationError: Given or parsed description is not a valid ToolDescription.
def add_builtin_tool(self, tool_def: BuiltinToolDefinition) -> bool: 
586    def add_builtin_tool(self, tool_def: BuiltinToolDefinition) -> bool:
587        """
588        Adds a built-in tool.
589
590        :param tool_def: The built-in tool definition.
591        :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
592        :raises ValueError: If the tool type is not "builtin" or required inputs are missing.
593        """
594        if tool_def.type != "builtin":
595            raise ValueError('Tool type is not "builtin"')
596
597        def call(**inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
598            required = tool_def.description.parameters.required or []
599            for param_name in required:
600                if param_name not in inputs:
601                    raise ValueError(f'Parameter "{param_name}" is required but not provided')
602
603            output = self._runtime.call(tool_def.description.name, inputs)
604            if tool_def.behavior.output_path is not None:
605                output = jmespath.search(tool_def.behavior.output_path, output)
606
607            return output
608
609        return self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_def.description, call_fn=call))

Adds a built-in tool.

Parameters
  • tool_def: The built-in tool definition. :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
Raises
  • ValueError: If the tool type is not "builtin" or required inputs are missing.
def add_restapi_tool( self, tool_def: RESTAPIToolDefinition, authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None) -> bool: 
611    def add_restapi_tool(
612        self,
613        tool_def: RESTAPIToolDefinition,
614        authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None,
615    ) -> bool:
616        """
617        Adds a REST API tool that performs external HTTP requests.
618
619        :param tool_def: REST API tool definition.
620        :param authenticator: Optional authenticator to inject into the request.
621        :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
622        :raises ValueError: If the tool type is not "restapi".
623        """
624        if tool_def.type != "restapi":
625            raise ValueError('Tool type is not "restapi"')
626
627        behavior = tool_def.behavior
628
629        def call(**inputs: dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
630            def render_template(template: str, context: dict[str, Any]) -> tuple[str, list[str]]:
631                import re
632
633                variables = set()
634
635                def replacer(match: re.Match):
636                    key = match.group(1).strip()
637                    variables.add(key)
638                    return str(context.get(key, f"{{{key}}}"))
639
640                rendered_url = re.sub(r"\$\{\s*([^}\s]+)\s*\}", replacer, template)
641                return rendered_url, list(variables)
642
643            # Handle path parameters
644            url, path_vars = render_template(behavior.base_url, inputs)
645
646            # Handle body
647            if behavior.body is not None:
648                body, body_vars = render_template(behavior.body, inputs)
649            else:
650                body, body_vars = None, []
651
652            # Handle query parameters
653            query_params = {k: v for k, v in inputs.items() if k not in set(path_vars + body_vars)}
654
655            # Construct a full URL
656            full_url = urlunparse(urlparse(url)._replace(query=urlencode(query_params)))
657
658            # Construct a request payload
659            request = {
660                "url": full_url,
661                "method": behavior.method,
662                "headers": behavior.headers,
663            }
664            if body:
665                request["body"] = body
666
667            # Apply authentication
668            if callable(authenticator):
669                request = authenticator(request)
670
671            # Call HTTP request
672            output = None
673            resp = self._runtime.call("http_request", request)
674            output = json.loads(resp["body"])
675
676            # Parse output path if defined
677            if behavior.output_path is not None:
678                output = jmespath.search(tool_def.behavior.output_path, output)
679
680            return output
681
682        return self.add_tool(Tool(desc=tool_def.description, call_fn=call))

Adds a REST API tool that performs external HTTP requests.

Parameters
  • tool_def: REST API tool definition.
  • authenticator: Optional authenticator to inject into the request. :returns: True if the tool was successfully added.
Raises
  • ValueError: If the tool type is not "restapi".
def add_tools_from_preset( self, preset_name: str, authenticator: Optional[Callable[[dict[str, Any]], dict[str, Any]]] = None):

697            raise ValueError(f'Tool preset "{preset_name}" does not exist')

711    ):

713        Create a MCP server and register its tools to agent.

716                     If there's already a MCP server with the same name, it raises RuntimeError.
717        :param params: Parameters for connecting to the MCP stdio server.
718        :param tools_to_add: Optional list of tool names to add. If None, all tools are added.
719        """

def remove_mcp_server(self, name: str): 
742    def remove_mcp_server(self, name: str):
743        """
744        Removes the MCP server and its tools from the agent, with terminating the MCP server process.
745

747                     If there's no MCP server matches the name, it raises RuntimeError.
748        """

751

758        self._tools = list(filter(lambda t: not t.desc.name.startswith(f"{mcp_server.name}-"), self._tools))

Removes the MCP server and its tools from the agent, with terminating the MCP server process.

Parameters
  • name: The unique name of the MCP server. If there's no MCP server matches the name, it raises RuntimeError.
